artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Sumiyoshiya Masagorō; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of a frowning man wearing a blue headscarf and kimono with blue ground and diamonds with birds, with brown foliage design over top; river landscape in background with thatch-roofed buildings in URQ and mountain in ULQ; square cartouche with red background with text, with vessel with ladle and tree leaves around edges of cartouche
markings: date seal: 子十一 {ne jūichi} (Rat 11) | censor seals:  渡邊 {Watanabe} | 米良 {Mera} | publisher\'s seal: {Sumimasa} | carver\'s seal: 彫竹 {hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Sixty-nine Stations along the Kiso Highway (Kiso rokujūkyū tsugi 木曽六十九驛)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: The Karasu River at Takasaki Station: (Actor Mimasu Daigorō IV as) Tabakoya Genshichi
